page.title: 05Work and Employment (cont)
page.content: in Auchterarder and 10.2% in Gleneagles Hotel within a radius of 5 miles, while 33% commuted to work within a 20 mile radius of the village, mostly to Stirling or Perth. Of the rest 3.8% travelled to work in the Glasgow area, one person worked in the Diplomatic Service abroad, and 7.7% used Blackford as a base for Scotland-wide operations in sales or sales management. The number of commuters has risen significantly in the past ten years. Of those in employment in the 30-39 age group only 16.6% were employed locally, compared with 70.6% of the 50-59 age group. Of the people commuting up to 20 miles, the most common employment was in local government or teaching, whilst for a woman the most common occupations lay in Hotel/domestic work, shop work and nursing.
